ARABIC: كِلْتَا ٱلْجَنَّتَيْنِ ءَاتَتْ أُكُلَهَا وَلَمْ تَظْلِم مِّنْهُ شَيْـًٔا وَفَجَّرْنَا خِلَٰلَهُمَا نَهَرًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Both gardens yielded their crops and did not suffer any loss, and We made a river flow right through the
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Each of the gardens yielded its fruit and did not withhold the least; and We made a stream flow in between them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Both the vineyards yielded abundant produce without failure and We caused a stream to flow in their midst
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and a stream flowing through the middle of the gardens.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Both the gardens gave yields and gave no shortfall in it – and We made a river to flow between the two.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Each of those two gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein, and We caused a river to gush forth in the midst of both.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Both these gardens yielded their fruits, and failed not aught thereof, and We caused a river to gush forth in their midst,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: each of the two gardens yielded its produce and failed naught in any wise; and We caused to gush amidst them a river.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Each of the gardens gave its fruit and withheld naught thereof. And We caused a river to gush forth therein.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: each garden produced its fruit and did not fail to yield its best; We even caused a river to gush forth in the midst of them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Each of the two gardens brought forth its produce and stinted not aught thereof; and We caused to gush forth in the midst of the twain a river.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Both gardens yielded their produce without stinting anything of it. And We had set a stream gushing through them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Each of those gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein: in the midst of them We caused a river to flow.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Each of those two gardens brought forth its produce, and failed not in the least therein, and We caused a river to gush forth in the midst of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Each of the two gardens yielded its produce and did not fail in the least and We made a river to gush through them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Both gardens produced their harvest in full, and suffered no loss. And We made a river flow through them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Each of the two gardens produced its fruit and did not fall short thereof in anything. And We caused to gush forth within them a river.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [18:33] Each of the two gardens (kiltā, ‘each [of the two]’ is a singular [noun] that indicates a dual [number]; and [the entire clause] is the subject) yielded (ātat is the predicate thereof) its produce, its fruit, without stinting, diminishing, anything thereof. And We caused a stream to gush forth therein, to run through them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Each of the gardens gave its fruit) every year (and withheld naught thereof. And We caused a river to gush forth therein) in their middle.
